description: From be- (“on, about, all over”) +‎ filth.

verbs.description: befilth (third-person singular simple present befilths, present participle befilthing, simple past and past participle befilthed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To cover with filth; make filthy; begrime.
examples: Shall he be crest-fall'n, if some looser brain, In flux of wit uncivilly befilth His slight composures? Shall his bosom faint, If drunken Censure belch out sour breath From Hatred's surfeit on his labour's front? Nay, say some half a dozen rancorous [...]
